title: Global Events - filter
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on the Global Events page
AND user is on the All or Archive tab
AND there are more than one event visible
custom_steps:
WHEN user clicks on the Filter field
AND user types into the field
custom_expected: THEN only the event cards appear for events that have the sequence of typed characters in their titles.

title: Create Event form - Cancel button
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user has clicked or tapped on the Create Event button
AND the Create Event form has appeared
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks or taps on the Cancel button
custom_expected: THEN the form disappears

title: Event page - Side nav - Attendees
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on an event page
AND user was the creator of that event
AND the side nav has appeared
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks or taps on the Attendees option in the side nav
custom_expected: THEN the event's Attendees page loads

title: Event page - Side Nav - Codes
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on an event page
AND user was the creator of that event
AND the side nav has appeared
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks or taps on the Codes option in the side nav
custom_expected: THEN the event's page to generate Codes appears.

title: Event page - Side nav - Welcome
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on an event page
AND user was the creator of that event
AND the side nav has appeared
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks or taps on the Welcome option in the side nav
custom_expected: THEN the event's Welcome page loads.

title: Event page - Overview - hover menu
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is on an individual event page
custom_steps:
WHEN user hovers cursor over the Overview header
OR user hovers cursor over the description
custom_expected:
THEN a nav bar appears, labeled: Web Content Display
AND at the right in the nav bar is a plus icon (+) and a 3-dot dropdown link

title: Event page - Add Overview description
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on an Event page
AND user is the owner who created that Event
AND directions have appeared beneath the Overview header
AND user has tapped or hovered over the directions text
AND the Web Content Display menu has appeared
custom_steps:
WHEN user clicks or taps on the plus sign in the Web Content Display menu
AND a popup with 3 items appears
AND user clicks or taps on the item: Simple Event Overview Structure
custom_expected:
THEN the New Simple Event Overview Structure modal appears

AND WHEN user adds text to the Title field
AND user adds text to the Event Overview field
AND user selects Publish
THEN the modal disappears
AND on the Event page, beneath the Overview header, the user's text has replaced the directions
AND the new title entered into the modal doesn't appear anywhere (the header shows the same title as before)

title: Event page - Generate code
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is an owner of an event
custom_steps:
WHEN user navigates to the event's Codes page
AND user enters a Group Name
AND user clicks on Get Code button
AND user clicks on the Save button
custom_expected:
THEN user sees a newly generated code
AND user can copy the code (not in MacFF)

title: Event code enables Create Account form
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that a Dept Owner has created an Event
AND Owner has generated a code
AND Owner has saved that code
custom_steps:
WHEN user has that code
AND user goes to the Login page
AND user clicks on "Create Account"
AND Create Account form appears
AND form is disabled
AND user inputs the code in the Registration Code field
custom_expected:
THEN the form is enabled
AND the Cancel button redirects user to Login Page
AND the "Log in" link redirects user to Login Page
AND (back on the form) all fields must be completed before the form will allow submission
AND user can complete all the fields
AND user can click the Create Account button
AND submission redirects to a message page with a link to login
AND clicking the link logs the user in
AND the landing page is the Event from which the code was generated.

AND this process works the same for a code generated in a Space.

![](index.php?/attachments/get/19804)

title: Global Events - all created events appear
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has previously created one or more events
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates to the Global Events page
custom_expected:
THEN all the created events appear
AND events created by any department appear
AND everybody is able to see the events

title: Event page - Cancel Update Event
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on an individual event page
AND the user is the event owner
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks or taps on the Update Event button
custom_expected:
THEN only the event owner should be able to see and click on the update button
AND the same modal as the Add Event modal pops up
AND the modal is pre-populated with the previously entered information
AND user can change or add information in any field (1. Name, 2. Description, 3. Max Attendees, 4. Location, 5. Featured Event, 6. Location, 7. Start and end date, 8. start and end time)
AND the user chooses to "Cancel" from the modal, then the modal should close and the event data should remain unchanged


![](index.php?/attachments/get/19307)

custom_steps: WHEN user clicks or taps on the Cancel button

title: Create Event - validate time format

custom_steps:

AND what is entered includes a number (a numeral, not written out)
custom_expected:
THEN field automatically formats the entry as hh:mm AM

[For example, entering 9pm will result in 09:00 AM.]

title: Event page - appearance at or below 991px
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is in a viewport at or below 991px
AND user was on the Global Events page
AND user selected an event
AND user was the Owner of that event
AND the event's page loaded
custom_expected:
THEN a header box appears at the top of the page
AND the background of the header box is an image
AND the image is proportional (not squished or stretched)
AND the event title is the top element in the header box
AND the event title is white and bold-faced and the largest font on the page
AND below the event title within the header box are 3 buttons vertically stacked: Follow, Update, Delete
AND the buttons are horizontally centered
AND the button labels are white and all-capped
AND the buttons have white borders
AND the Follow button is dark blue
AND the Update Event button is black
AND the Delete Event button is red
AND below the header box is a dark blue header: Overview
AND beneath the Overview header is a set of directions (see screenshot below)
AND the event title, Overview header, and directions are left aligned
AND below the description is a red button
AND the button has a white all-caps label: I-Will-Not-Attend
AND below the Not Attend button is a dark blue box
AND the dark blue box has a white bold-faced all-caps header: Time & Location
AND beneath that header are 3 white semi-bold-faced sub-headers: Starts, Ends, Location
AND beneath each sub-header is white non-bold-faced data the event creator chose when creating the event
AND the day is formatted MM/DD/YYYY
AND the time is formatted as 12-hour hh:mm AM/PM
AND the header, sub-headers, and data are all left-aligned

![](index.php?/attachments/get/19360)

custom_steps: WHEN user taps or clicks on the Follow button
custom_expected:
THEN label on the button changes to Unfollow
AND user receives an email from inside@mlb.com that they have followed the event
AND the subject line of the email is: Message about the item you are following
AND the body of the email is: You are following the item [event title]. You will be notified on any updates to this item.

title: OBSOLETE - Event page - Attendees chart - Follower

AND user did not create the event
custom_steps:
WHEN user clicks or taps on the Follow button

AND WHEN user logs out and logs back in as the creator of the event
AND user navigates to that event page
AND user clicks or taps on Attendees in the toggle
AND the Attendees chart appears
custom_expected: THEN the non-creator user's name does not appear in a row in the chart.

title: OBSOLETE - Event page - Update for Followers
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user has followed an event
custom_steps: WHEN the owner of the event updates any detail of the event
custom_expected:
THEN the user receives an email from inside@mlb.com about the change that was made
AND the subject line of the email is: Message about the item you are following
AND the body of the email is:
Event [event title] has been updated. Please click the link to view the events page [URL]
AND the URL redirects to the event's individual page on InsideMLB

title: OBSOLETE - Event page - Delete for Followers
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user has Followed an event
custom_steps: WHEN that event is deleted
custom_expected:
THEN user receives an email from inside@mlb.com
AND the subject line of the email is: Message about the item you are following
AND the body of the email is:
[event title] has been canceled or it expired.
You are no longer following this event.

custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on any column header (except Location)
custom_expected:
THEN the events change order, with the rows sorted alphabetically or numerically by the data in that selected column
AND clicking on the column header a second time reverses the sorting.

title: Global Events - select event from table
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on the Global Events page
AND user has selected the table view
AND all the events appear in the table
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks or taps on an event name
custom_expected: THEN page redirects within the same tab to that event's individual page.

title: Global Events - select event from grid
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on the Global Events page
AND event boxes appear in a grid
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks or taps on a white label / Event title in an event box
custom_expected: THEN page redirects within the same tab to the individual event page that matches the label selected

title: Global Events - appearance
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is on the Global Events page
custom_expected:
THEN the page looks like the photo below
(image is of the Archive tab but the All tab shows the same thing when it's populated with events)

![](index.php?/attachments/get/19853)

title: Create Event form - appearance
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is a Dept Owner
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks or taps on the Create Event button
custom_expected:
THEN Create Event form appears
AND it looks like the photo below:

![](index.php?/attachments/get/19861)

title: Create Event - upload Image
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user clicks on Create Event
custom_steps:
WHEN the user attempts to upload an event image 
AND saves/creates the event
AND navigates to the Global Events page

*image requirements: 
- Assume User uploads form their machine
- NO Drag & Drop
- NO Thumbnails
- Max File Size: 5 MB
- File Types: .gif, .jpg, .png
- Field NOT required
custom_expected:
THEN the image appears in the event's card in the grid view
AND the image does not appear in the table view
AND the image does not appear on the event's individual page

title: Create Event - Create Event button
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is a Dept Owner
AND user has opened the Create Event form
custom_steps:
WHEN user completes all required fields (Location, Categories, and Image are NOT required)
AND no error messages have appeared
AND user clicks or taps on Create Event button
custom_expected:
THEN form popup disappears
AND success popup appears
AND it looks like the photo below

AND WHEN user clicks on the link
THEN user is redirected to the new event's individual page.

![](index.php?/attachments/get/19862)

title: Create Event - success
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on the Create Event modal
AND user has selected Featured
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks the Create button
custom_expected:
THEN a success popup appears
AND popup include's the event page URL
AND WHEN user clicks on the URL
THEN user is redirected to the event's page
AND event appears on the main page as a Featured Event
AND event appears on the Global Events page
AND event appears on the Global Calendar.

title: Create Event - Calendar sync
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is an Owner in a Department
custom_steps:
WHEN user creates an event
AND user navigates to the Global Calendar
AND user looks at the day the event is scheduled for
custom_expected:
THEN user sees the event appear on that date
AND all the information of the event is correct: title, time, location

title: Create Event - Events sync
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is an Owner in a Department
custom_steps:
WHEN user creates an event
AND user navigates to the Global Events page
custom_expected:
THEN the user's created event appears on the page
AND the title is correct
AND selecting the event redirects the page to the event page
AND all the information of the event is correct: title, day, start time, end time, location

title: Create Event - Featured Event function
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is an Owner in a Department
AND user has opened the Create Event form
custom_steps:
WHEN user fills out all required fields correctly
AND user clicks or taps the Categories Select button
AND the Categories modal appears
AND user checks the Featured Event checkbox
AND user closes that modal
AND user clicks or taps on the Create Event button
AND user then navigates to the Main Page
custom_expected:
THEN the Featured Event user just created appears at the top of the page
AND all the information is correct

![](index.php?/attachments/get/19863)

custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on the Global Events page
AND user is the Owner of an event
custom_steps: WHEN user selects that event
custom_expected:
THEN the event's individual page appears
AND it defaults to the Welcome page
AND it looks like the photo below

![](index.php?/attachments/get/19854)

custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on the Global Events page
AND user is the Owner of an event
custom_steps:
WHEN user selects that event
AND event's individual page appears
AND user clicks on Attendees in the side nav
custom_expected:
THEN the Attendees page appears
AND it looks like the photo below

![](index.php?/attachments/get/19855)

title: Event page - Codes - appearance
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on the Global Events page
AND user is the Owner of an event
custom_steps:
WHEN user selects that event
AND event's individual page appears
AND user clicks on Codes in the side nav
custom_expected:
THEN the Codes page appears
AND it looks like the photo below

![](index.php?/attachments/get/19856)

title: Event page - Edit/Update Image
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is on the Global Events page
AND user selects an event
AND user is the event's owner
custom_steps:
WHEN the user clicks on "Edit Event Details" button
AND replaces existing image in the event's update page
AND saves
AND navigates back to the Global Events page

*image requirements:
- Assume User uploads form their machine
- NO Drag & Drop
- NO Thumbnails
- Max File Size: 5 MB
- File Types: .gif, .jpg, .png
- Field NOT required
custom_expected:
THEN the new image appears in the event's card in the grid view
AND the image does not appear in the table view
AND the image does not appear on the event's individual page

title: Event page - Will Attend - Attendee email
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on an individual event page
AND the "I will attend" button is displayed
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks or taps on the "I will attend" button
custom_expected:
THEN the user receives an email from inside@mlb.com confirming their registration
AND the email has an .ics attachment
AND opening the attachment adds the event to the user's Outlook calendar
AND the dates and times in the user's calendar are correct
AND the URL in the body of the email redirects to the event's individual page on the InsideMLB site.

title: Event page - Not Attend - Attendee email
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on an individual event page
AND user has already chosen to Attend the event
AND button appears with the label "I will not attend"
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks or taps on the "I will not attend" button
custom_expected:
THEN user is unregistered from the event
AND user receives an email from inside@mlb.com noting that
AND the email has an .ics attachment

[The following will happen on a Windows platform but not a Mac:]
AND opening the attachment deletes the event entry from the user's Outlook calendar

title: Event page - Update - Attendee email
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user has registered for an event (selected the "I will attend" button)
custom_steps: WHEN the owner of the event makes any change to the event
custom_expected:
THEN the user receives an email from inside@mlb.com about the change
AND the email has an .ics attachment
AND opening the attachment adds the changes to the user's Outlook calendar
AND a change in date will move the entry in the calendar (so that there is not an old entry and a new entry at the same time)
AND the dates, times, location, and title in the user's calendar match the changes that were made
AND the URL in the email redirects to the event's individual page in InsideMLB.

title: Event page - Delete - Attendee email
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user chose to Attend an event
custom_steps: WHEN the event owner deletes the event
custom_expected:
THEN user receives an email from inside@mlb.com noting the cancellation of the event
AND the email has an .ics attachment

[The following will happen on a Windows platform but not a Mac:]
AND opening the attachment deletes the event entry from the user's Outlook calendar

title: Event page - Edit Event
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on an individual event page
AND the user is the event owner
AND the Edit Event Details button has appeared
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks or taps on the Edit button
custom_expected:
THEN the same modal as the Create Event modal pops up
AND the modal is correctly pre-populated with the previously entered information [especially check start and end dates, start and end times]
AND user can change or add information 
AND user can click or tap on the Edit Event Details button
AND the new details that they entered are saved
AND the new details replace previous values on the individual event page

title: Event page - event updates in all locations
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on an individual event page
AND user is the owner of that event
custom_steps: WHEN user successfully updates the event's dates or times
custom_expected:
THEN any change the user just made appears on Global Events page
AND changes appear in the event on the Global Calendar
AND changes appear in Featured Events if the event was featured

title: Featured event expires
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user creates an event
AND user has marked the event as Featured
AND user navigates to the main page
AND the event appears in the Featured Events section
custom_steps: WHEN the event's End Time arrives
custom_expected:
THEN the event disappears from the Featured section within 5 minutes of its End Time
AND the event moves to the Archive tab on the Global Events page

title: Create Event - delete event
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user has created an event
AND user has navigated to the event's page
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on Delete
custom_expected:
THEN a popup appears
AND WHEN user selects Yes, Delete
THEN event is deleted.

title: Event page - Delete Event - popup "Yes"
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on an individual event page
AND user has selected the Delete Event button
AND the delete popup has appeared
custom_steps:
WHEN user clicks or taps on the "Yes" button
AND user navigates to the Global Events page
custom_expected:
THEN the event no longer appears in the grid of events

AND WHEN user navigates to the Global Calendar page
THEN the event no longer appears on the calendar

AND WHEN user navigates to the Main Page
IF the event was a Featured Event
THEN it no longer appears at the top of the page.

title: Test responsiveness
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is on a desktop platform
custom_steps:
WHEN user decreases the viewport
AND WHEN user expands the viewport
custom_expected:
THEN all elements continue to appear on the page
AND no elements overlap any other in any viewport
AND images stay proportionate (not stretched or squished)
AND all elements function as expected.

Note: In Windows IE and Edge, Chatter images will be stretched.

title: Test mobile
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is using a mobile device
custom_expected:
THEN all elements appear on the page
AND no elements overlap any other
AND all elements function as expected
